fields.description:
h3. Summary
Color Scheme Settings for Search Box in Confluence 6.14.0 does not take effect

Confluence 6.14 introduced an [enhanced Confluence Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-14-release-notes-963655609.html#Confluence6.14ReleaseNotes-FindworkfasterwiththenewConfluencesearch] and this could be the reason behind the *Search Field Background* and *Search Field Text* from the [Color Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customizing-color-schemes-135906.html] is not applied properly.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.14.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the [Color Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customizing-color-schemes-135906.html] admin configuration page
# Click *Edit* and change the color schemes below:
#* Search Field Background
#* Search Field Text

h3. Expected Results
Color schemes for the quick search box on the top right should be changed accordingly

h3. Actual Results
Color schemes that are modified don't take effect on the search box

h3. Information
* The color set in the *Search Field Text* only applies to the _magnifying glass logo_ instead of the _search_ text
* The same customization applied in Confluence 6.11.2 will take effect:
 !confluence 6.11.2 search bar.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Third-party theme plugin
fields.summary: Color Scheme Settings for Search Box in Confluence 6.14.0 does not take effect

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a page tree is moved to another space, some of the links between pages are broken.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server 6.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some pages. I.e. following the page tree below:
{code:java}
Parent page
├─ Child page 1
├─ Child page 2
│  └─ Child page 3
└─ Child page 4{code}

 # Copy the links to all 4 child pages and insert them into the Parent page;
 # Move the parent page to a different space

h3. Expected Results

The links should change to point to their new location
h3. Actual Results

Links are changed from working links to links that redirect the Page Editor, with the page title filled in but nothing else. If you check the broken link, you are also unable to edit it:

  !broken-link.png|thumbnail! 

 
 
h3. Notes

The broken links were changed from 
 [https://<BASE-URL>/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/5505026/Child+page+1|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/5505026/Child+page+1] 
to 
 [https://<BASE-URL>/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=TS&title=Child+page+1|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=TS&title=Child+page+1]
h3. Workaround

No other workaround besides editing the page and changing the links.
fields.summary: Moving pages between spaces breaks links

fields.description:
If we create *two or more events* of the same event type, Team Calendars is likely to send a *single email notification* for them.

Requirements for this to happen:
 * Start time must have a *difference of less than 5 minutes*
 * The events must be on the same Calendar
 * The event types *must be the same*
 * The event must not be of the *Event* event type

Example:
 # Create one event of the type Travel set to 3:30 PM
 # Create *another Travel event* set to 3:33 PM
 # Create the last travel event set to 3:35 PM
 # Set reminders to *5 minutes before*

*Results* :The notification for the events set at 3:30 and 3:33 PM is sent on the same email. The event set for 3:35 PM has its own email notification.

 

This is possibly related to this issue:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48422

 

*Suggested solution*:

Improve the calendar job execution to be more granular so the reminders actually correspond to the settings. Or at least *split the notifications* in different emails.
fields.summary: Improve Granularity of Event Reminders in Team Calendars

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
Due to an issue with Confluence's handling of {{CustomContentEntity}} within the {{ContentPropertyService}} API, using the "Purge All" option in the Space Trash can fail with a {{org.hibernate.StaleStateException}}. This can affect spaces which contains a custom entity created by {{ContentPropertyService}}. An example is the Numbered Headings plugin, which uses this API.

h2. Environment
# Confluence 6.13.0 Server
# Numbered Headings 5.2.2 for Server ([link|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/16063/numbered-headings/version-history]) -- this is just an example, there may be other plugins impacted by this bug

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page
# In Edit mode, press the "Numbered Headings" button in the tool bar (screenshot: [^press_this.png])
** Note: Whenever the "Numbered Headings" button is pressed, a row will be inserted in the CONTENT table which looks like this:
{code}
 contentid | hibernateversion | contenttype |         title         |      lowertitle       | version |             creator              |      creationdate       |           lastmodifier           |       lastmoddate       | prevver | content_status | pageid  | spaceid |                                       pluginkey                                       | pluginver |
-----------+------------------+-------------+-----------------------+-----------------------+---------+----------------------------------+-------------------------+----------------------------------+-------------------------+----------------+---------+----------------+---------+---------+----------------+----------+-----------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------+
   1409026 |                2 | CUSTOM      | nl_avisi_nh           | nl_avisi_nh           |       1 | 2c94b0bb681b718701681b71f8510000 | 2019-01-17 18:05:04.472 | 2c94b0bb681b718701681b71f8510000 | 2019-01-17 18:05:04.472 |         | current        | 1409025 |  491521 | com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-content-property-storage:content-property | 6.13.0    |
{code}
# Save the page (the page content doesn't matter)
# Delete the page
# Go to the space trash, and try to "Purge All".

h2. Expected behavior
The space trash is purged without issue

h2. Actual behavior
Stacktrace will be reproduced in the UI and in the logs. Snippet below, and Full stacktrace here: [^full_stacktrace.txt]).
{code}
2019-01-17 18:05:46,086 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao] unIndex Unable to index object: [com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-content-property-storage:content-property] custom: nl_avisi_nh v.1 (1409026) -- Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1; nested exception is org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1
 -- space: 491521 | url: /pages/doemptytrash.action | traceId: ccc8b7a19e645d3c | userName: admin | referer: http://confluence.example.com/pages/emptytrash.action?key=FOO | action: doemptytrash
org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateOptimisticLockingFailureException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1; nested exception is org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:283)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateTemplate.doExecute(HibernateTemplate.java:368)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateTemplate.executeWithNativeSession(HibernateTemplate.java:328)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQueryStringParams(HibernateObjectDao.java:524)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQueryStringParam(HibernateObjectDao.java:400)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.hibernate.AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao.getLatestVersionsOfAttachments(AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.CachingAttachmentDao.getLatestVersionsOfAttachments(CachingAttachmentDao.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager.getLatestVersionsOfAttachments(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:280)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DelegatorAttachmentManager.getLatestVersionsOfAttachments(DelegatorAttachmentManager.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.CachingAttachmentManager.getLatestVersionsOfAttachments(CachingAttachmentManager.java:57)
...
{code}

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, purge the offending page(s) *individually* from the space trash, which will then allow the "Purge All" option to work again.

h3. *Numbered Headings*

In the case of *Numbered Headings* specifically, you can use this query to identify spaces/pages that may be affected:

{code}
SELECT s.spacekey, 
       c.contentid, 
       c.title, 
       c.contenttype, 
       c.content_status 
FROM   content c 
JOIN   spaces s 
ON     c.spaceid = s.spaceid 
WHERE  c.contentid IN 
       ( 
              SELECT pageid 
              FROM   content 
              WHERE  contenttype = 'CUSTOM' 
              AND    title = 'nl_avisi_nh' 
              AND    content_status = 'deleted');
{code}

h3. *Comala Workflows*

In the case of *Comala Workflows* specifically, you can use this query to identify spaces/pages that may be affected:

{code}
select * FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted';
{code}

and then to manually delete the above pages, we need to first delete out the child dependent pages before we can delete the above pages using these steps:

# Shutdown Confluence
# (!) Backup the Confluence database
# Run these manual SQL to delete the affected pages (and their child pages)
{code}
delete from CONTENTPROPERTIES where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted');

delete from BODYCONTENT where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted');

delete from CONTENTPROPERTIES where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT where PREVVER in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted'));

delete from BODYCONTENT where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT where PREVVER in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted'));

delete from CONTENT where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT where PREVVER in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted'));

delete from CONTENT where CONTENTID in (select CONTENTID FROM CONTENT where CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM' and LOWERTITLE = 'comalaworkflows' and CONTENT_STATUS = 'deleted');
{code}
# Startup Confluence
#* Navigate to *Confluence Administration* » *General Configuration* » *Content Indexing*
#** Rebuild the indexes to realign the Lucene index files from disk with the manual DB changes we made above
# Navigate to any Space and attempt to purge out the Trash and it should succeed
fields.summary: "Purge All" space trash fails with "org.hibernate.StaleStateException" due to Confluence's handling of CustomContentEntity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Sometimes it may be helpful to set a different default search parameter in Confluence's full search, such as leaving the *Personal search* enabled in the *In space* option of it.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Add the ability to change the default settings of Confluence's full search.

h3. Why this is important   

* If a determined search with pre-defined parameters is made often, it will save some time and be of more assistance if the parameters are set to be the default search in Confluence's full search.

h3. Workaround 
* Create a direct link to the search that is frequently made, with the URL being in the following format: 
** <Confluence_base_ URL>/dosearchsite.action?cql=space.type+in+(%22favourite%22%2C%22global%22%2C%22personal%22) 

(!) *Please remember to change the base URL to match your Confluence's instance*
fields.summary: Add ability to change Confluence's full search default parameters

fields.description:
Hi,

in the new search UI, start a search for something that can actually be found in your instance.

Then quickly select a result while the search is actually still ongoing.

Depending on your timing, your will actually click the SECOND result because the result list has been moved up a few pixels because the search finished in the meantime, and the space the search-ongoing icon took has collapsed on you.

Example video for Atlassian staff: CSP-243965

With the old UI I only searched via the small top bar in the navigation so I assume the old search showed the loading icon inline with the words I searched for?

I don't actually remember it that well to be honest, even if it's just a gone few days now :D

I dig the new search though, and just thought relocating the loading icon would be a nice improvement, because to me that seems to be the easiest fix to stop the results moving after the search has finished.

As usual, once stuff changes everything gets looked at more closely than before ;)

Best regards

Oliver
fields.summary: New search UI: Move loading icon to avoid vertical result relocation after search finishes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Search return "Something went wrong" after session timed out instead of redirecting user to Login page.
h3. Environment

Confluence version 6.14.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Login* into Confluence.
 # Open a *new browser tab* and access any Confluence page in the new tab.
 # *Logout* from Confluence in the first browser tab (in *Step 1*).
 # In the *new browser tab*, Click the search box and search for any keyword.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence will redirect user to a Login page since the session is terminated/expired when user logout in the other tab.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence does not redirect user to a Login page.

The following message return in the Search box when user tried to search after session timed out:
{noformat}
Something went wrong. Refresh the page, or contact your admin if this keeps happening.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The issue can be replicated when the default session timed out (60 minutes) without manually Logout from Confluence in other tab.
h3. Workaround

Logout then re login into Confluence to perform the search
fields.summary: Confluence Search return "Something went wrong" after session timed out instead of redirecting user to Login page.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When adjusting responsive table columns, a width value is added.  This is not able to be seen or adjusted without modifying the source code (using an unsupported Source Code Editor).

h3. Suggested Solution
For the purpose of having greater control over table columns, allow for these values to either be modified or removed/turned off completely within the page editor to return full responsive table functionality.
 
h3. Workaround
Modify the source code using Source Editor manually.
fields.summary: Width values for adjusted responsive table columns should be modifiable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some disaster recovery plans it is necessary to have immediate access to content as an HTML or PDF export. However, restricted pages not being exportable in PDF and HTML formats leaves content dependent on Confluence's restore to be accessible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow option for system administrators to be able to export restricted pages to PDF and HTML.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Administrators to Export Restricted Pages to PDF and HTML

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A Confluence user that has no login permission in Jira tries to create/use Jira Issue Macro while editing a Confluence page will send hundreds of requests to Jira application.

h3. Environment
* Confluence integrated with Jira
* Confluence user has no login permission in Jira
* Jira Service Desk installed
* Context path configured in Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, create a new Page
 # Add Jira Issue Macro

h3. Expected Results
* No spam of requests to Jira application.
* No timeout error in the UI, instead show a login failure.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the *Jira's access_log* file:
{code}
10.60.3.46 555x801x1 confluence [29/Jan/2019:09:15:07 +0800] "GET /j7130/j7130/servicedesk/customer/portals?xoauth_requestor_id=confluence HTTP/1.1" 302 - 9 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.4.1 (Java/1.8.0_74)" "140v2he"
{code}
(i) There are 1400+ requests of the same on Jira by just a single action in Confluence
(!) Note the duplicate (doubled) of Jira's context path {{/j7130/j7130}}

The below error is seen in the UI of Confluence:
!confluence.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a Jira Issue Macro will send hundreds of requests to Jira

fields.description: Atlassian Confluence Server from version 6.12.0 (or earlier), and before version 6.13.1, or before version 6.14.0 allows an authenticated user to download a deleted page via the word export feature.
fields.summary: Download a deleted page via word export - CVE-2018-20237

fields.description: The Page Tree Search macro ought to have the same options as the Search used for the Page Tree Macro (name be able to use relative references like @self and @parent)
fields.summary: Page Tree Search macro and Page Tree Macro search should be consistent

fields.description: I have a set of related spaces.   I would like search macros placed on pages in any of these paces to search all the related spaces (and only those spaces).
fields.summary: Search Box Macros should take a list of spaces to include in search.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing the part of bullet list to numbers list will change the whole list to numbers list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a 4 line bullet list of text
 # Select middle 2 lines and change them to numbers list

h3. Expected Results
Only middle 2 lines will change to numbers list.

h3. Actual Results
All lines change to numbers list.

h3. Notes
In Confluence 6.12 and bellow we could mix bullet lists and numbers list in the same list.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing part of bullet list to numbers will change the whole list to numbers.

fields.description:
(i) We would like to reuse the link to the *Watch this Blog* and add it directly to a Confluence page (Homepage).

!image-2019-01-28-08-26-32-153.png!

We are currently using the macro 'Blog Posts' to show the blogs of the last 7 days on a lot of Confluence spaces.

(+) It would help us in our *user adoption* if this 'Blog Posts' macro could be extended by the Watch this Blog or if we get an easy way to embed the *Watch this Blog* as a link.

 

(x) It is currently not possible because the *Watch this Blog* contains a user specific token and can not be reused.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to Watch this Blog button to the Blog Posts macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When in Edit mode on a page that has the “Excerpt Include” macro, clicking “Go to Included Page” merely loads the current page.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.11.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 #  Insert the “Excerpt Include” macro to the page and link it to another page on the site
 # Click *Save*
 # When taken to the editor, click on the macro to load the options bar
 # Click “Go to Included page”

h3. Expected Results

You should be taken to the page you included in the macro in a new tab.
h3. Actual Results

The *current* page is loaded in a new tab, as opposed to the page that was included in the macro.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro does not take you to included page when in edit mode

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to disable the automatic permissions that are inherited on child pages, from the configured page restrictions on parent pages. This is a limitation in select cases where a user might not want those permissions to be automatically applied in the first place.

h4. Suggested Solution
The ability to simply select whether restrictions from a parent page should be applied to its child pages would already solve this issue, and provide greater freedom to Confluence admins.
fields.summary: Ability to disable automatically inherited Page Restrictions
Include versioning of REST API commands

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Issue unable to display issue summary in Personal Task intermittently

Jira Issue Macro may not load the *Issue Summary* when navigating to the [Tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/add-assign-and-view-tasks-590260030.html#Add,Assign,andViewTasks-Viewtasks] page from user profile and this happens intermittently.

h3. Environment
* Application:
** Confluence 6.13.0
** Jira 7.13.0
* Browser:
** Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)
** Firefox 64.0.2 (64-bit)
** IE


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and insert a task that includes:
#* Mentioning a user
#* Jira Issue Macro
# Go to the profile page of the mentioned user and click on the *Tasks* tab to view all the tasks that is assigned

h3. Expected Results
Jira Issue Summary can be loaded correctly
 !expected result.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Jira Issue Summary sometimes loads indefinitely but never return with a result
 !actual result.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Information
(i) Possibly related to CONFSERVER-56588
In the successful attempt, log below can be observed after enabling *HTTP Dump Log* in Jira and {{*org.apache.http*}} DEBUG logging in Confluence:
{code:title=atlassian.confluence.log}
2019-01-25 10:03:32,298 DEBUG [JIM Marshaller:thread-14] [http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec] execute Executing request GET /j7130/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?tempMax=1000&returnMax=true&validateQuery=false&jqlQuery=KEY+IN+%28TP-1%29&field=type&field=summary&field=status&field=resolution&field=statuscategory&field=link HTTP/1.1
{code}
{code:title=atlassian-jira-http-dump.log}
127.0.0.1 o600x718x1 admin [25/Jan/2019:10:00:42 +0800] "GET http://localhost:47130/j7130/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml HTTP/1.1" 200 1608 0.0360 - "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.5 (Java/1.8.0_131)" "1um6jtn"
        ___ Request _____________________________________________________
        Request URL Parameters :
                tempMax=1000
                returnMax=true
                validateQuery=false
                jqlQuery=KEY IN (TP-1)
...
{code}

However, in the attempt when the Jira Issue Summary is not loading, no log is observed in both Confluence and Jira.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the same page since this is an intermittent issue
fields.summary: Jira Issue unable to display issue summary in Personal Task intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Image cannot be displayed when exporting a page with more than 50 images into Word file

When using the [Export to Word|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-724764824.html#ExportContenttoWord,PDF,HTMLandXML-ExportsinglepagestoWordorPDF] feature on a Confluence page that contains more than 50 images, the exported Word file cannot display all of the images properly or appears to be broken.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.11.2
Confluence 6.13.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence and upload 55 different image files into the page
#* (i) They can be the same image, but they all must be *different files*
# Save the Page and make sure all 55 images are displaying properly in the Confluence Page
# Export the page into Word file


h3. Expected Results
The exported Word file is able to display all 55 images properly

h3. Actual Results
Any images that are after the *50th* image will be broken.
* Broken Image exported from Confluence 6.11.2 viewed in Microsoft Word 2016:
 !6.11.2 export.png|thumbnail! 
* Broken Image exported from Confluence 6.13.0 viewed in Microsoft Word 2016:
 !6.13.0 export.png|thumbnail! 
* Broken Image is not displaying any error message in Office 365 Subscription on Mac OS X
* Exported result:
 [^Much+More+Image+Here.doc] 


h3. Information
* This is the image file that is being used to test (file size around 2KB):
 !atlassian logo.png|thumbnail! 
* Also performed the test with a larger image at around 2MB and same outcome is observed (images after the 50th starts to break)
* Turning the [Logging and Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-logging-181535215.html] for Confluence to *Diagnostic* mode during the Word Export but no error messages are logged.

(i) As the reason behind why the image breaks after the 50th image is not known yet, this bug might be encountered before or after 50 images depends on the environment.
fields.summary: Image cannot be displayed when exporting a page with more than 50 images into Word file

fields.description:
Confluence 6.13 and later supports both Oracle JDK and AdoptOpenJDK. Previously we bundled the Oracle JRE. 

This change will bundle AdoptOpenJDK 8u192-b12, which will be used when installing Confluence using the Windows and Linux installer. 

Admins can still choose to switch to Oracle JDK if they prefer. See [Change the Java vendor or version Confluence uses|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Change+the+Java+vendor+or+version+Confluence+uses]

*Note:* Confluence 6.13.0, 6.13.1, and 6.14.0 all bundled Oracle JRE. 
6.13.2+ and 6.14.1+ will have AdoptOpenJDK.
fields.summary: Bundle AdoptOpenJDK with Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Links in Team Calendar email notifications, reminding you of a future event (a month or more ahead) at some time before it occurs (for example reminding you 4 weeks, or 5 minutes before) do not bring you to the month mentioned in the calendar itself.  When clicking on any of the links, they instead bring you to the current date and month.

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 12.10.24.png|thumbnail! 

The link in the email is similar to <confluenceurl>/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=729f1c21-52c6-40bb-8d1f-dd191d0866f1.  There is nothing in the link that would reference a future date, only the correct calendar.

h3. Suggested Solution

Links in event notification emails should bring you to the exact date mentioned.
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Links in Team Calendar email reminders should bring you to the specific calendar month

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot add inline comments to similar words that exist inside a macro body, which could also be hidden. For example, in a page, a macro body contains the text "This is inside a macro" and the text "I am not inside" lives outside the macro. 
 !Edit_-_Inline_Comment_issue_-_Demonstration_Space_-_Confluence.jpg|thumbnail!

Adding an inline comment to the word "inside" results in this error
{noformat}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce
h4. Steps to reproduce for hidden [Page Properties Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-properties-macro-184550024.html]:

Cannot add inline comment to a string or substring which is similar to the content inside hidden macro
 # Start editing a page, insert a "Page properties" macro with the option "Hidden" switched ON.
 # Type some text inside the macro.
 # Type the same text outside the macro.
 # Save the page.

From now on you won't be able to make inline comment for any substring, which matches the text inside the macro.

!hidden page properties.png|thumbnail!
h4. Steps to reproduce for anchor link:

Cannot add inline comment to a string or substring which is similar to anchor link
 # Start editing a page, insert a TOC macro
 # Adding heading 1 with some text
 # Save a page

From now on we cannot add an inline comment into any string or substring of heading text (in step 2). You can use another macro which can generate an anchor link other than TOC macro.

Some example macros are: [Table of Content Zone Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html], Link to an [Anchor Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/anchor-macro-182682072.html] on the same page.
h3. Expected Results

Inline comments will be placed successfully.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
h3. Notes

Seems like _matchIndex_ and _numMatches_ values are incorrect due to the texts inside the macro body being matched.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# When connected to the internet, the Companion App checks and compares the computer's time with the NTP time.
# If the time is out of sync, it will throw the error saying "System clock is incorrect"
# Sometimes the Companion App will start before the computer has time to sync with the NTP server, which will them prompt the error message as well.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Set the Companion App to auto start on OS boot.
# Start the computer in another location where the local time is different.
# If the computer boots up, but has not synced with the NTP server to update it's time, the Companion App will throw the "System clock is incorrect" error.

# The issue can also be reproducible by simply changing the local time of the machine, and then setting it to update using the NTP server.
# Start the Atlassian Companion app, and it will throw the error, since it takes some time for the computer to sync with the NTP server time.

h3. Expected behavior
# When starting up, the Companion app should wait awhile for the computer time to sync with the network time, to prevent the error message from appearing.
# Or, there should be an option to disable the checking.

h3. Current behavior
 # Companion App throws "System clock is incorrect" error message, as the computer has have the time to sync with the network time.
 # In some cases, the app will crash on boot, and but works fine if started manually after.
fields.summary: Companion App throws System clock error if it starts up before the computer has synced with the NTP server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The bug was found when vendor was testing their macro but this issue affects any macro using "confluence-content" parameters. This affects both Cloud and Server. 

_All details here are provided by the vendor_

Replication steps:

Preparation (in space SRC):
 # Add a macro that takes a page as a parameter to a page A
 # Set page C in the current space (SRC) as the value of the parameter

Different variants of the bug:
 # Copy-paste the macro:
 ## Open editor for the page A
 ## Select the macro placeholder in editor and choose copy
 ## Open editor for a page B in another space DEST
 ## Paste the macro from page A to the editor for page B
 ## Save page B
 -> the macro does not point to the page SRC:C anymore
 -> unless the DEST space has a page with title C the macro breaks (eg "unable to render \{include}
The page could not be found" is shown)

 # Copy page and change location in editor to new space
 ## Open the page A
 ## Choose copy
 ## In the editor opened for copy of page A, click 'location' (next to breadcrumb)
 ## Choose a page in another space (eg DEST) as the new parent
 ## Save
 -> same problems as in variant A
 # Copy page directly to new space (without children)
 ## same as B but choose a parent page in different space already in the "pick location" dialog opened after clicking on "copy"
 ## the "pick location" dialog is not shown at all on Cloud, so 3rd affects only Server

h3. Expected

When macro is copied to new space the relative link to a page in its original space is qualified with the original space key (turned into an absolute link)
h3. Actual

The link breaks
h3. Affects/Impact

This affects any macro saving a page reference to a macro parameter with type "confluence-content" (for example "Include page" or "Excerpt include")

*Customer Installation Impacts: 1,215*
h3. Notes
- in all cases using a Link to page A works correctly but macro parameters break
- the macro user (or developer) cannot choose to use an absolute link to a page in current space by qualifying with the space key when setting the parameter value. Confluence will automatically (in some cases) turn links to pages in current space to be relative (always using absolute references would also solve the problems with page titles including ':'...)
- the copy operations seem to work correctly when the editor is not involved, so the bug is in handling the macro parameters in "editor format" (ie the data-macro-* attributes on the macro placeholder)
- have not tested if this happens also with macros with body, it happens at least for any bodiless macro
- tested on Confluence Cloud, and Confluence 6.0 + 6.12 on Server

h3. Workaround
No current workaround. This will be change once a workaround is possible
fields.summary: Macro parameters referencing pages in current space break when copying to new space

fields.description:
Currently, when deploying Companion App on Windows OS using the MSI, it will not start automatically.

If the MSI is distributed across the organization by the system administrator, if the user is not aware and doesn't reboot the machine afterward, they will still get prompted to install the Companion app upon trying to edit the attachment.

This will result in a new installation of the Companion app on top of the one that is already installed.

The solution for this is to make the Application start automatically after it is installed.
----
h5. Current scenario:

After user runs the App for the first time, the registry key will be added in the following path
{noformat}
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run{noformat}
h5. The Workaround

One of our customers came up with a solution to add the registry key automatically in the HKLM during the deployment to ensure that the app is started automatically without having the user to start it manually.

 
{panel:title=Custom script for Companion App MSI|titleBGColor=#d3dded|bgColor=#d3dded}
msiexec /qn /i "Atlassian Companion.msi"
 reg add "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v "electron.app.Atlassian Companion" /d "\"C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian Companion\Atlassian Companion.exe\"" /f
{panel}
fields.summary: Companion app MSI doesn't start automatically

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Calendar creator cannot receive notification about events which were created by another user *for the first time*.
h3. Environment
 * Team Calendar v. 6.0.25
 * Confluence needed to be integrated with SMTP server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login Confluence with User A
 # Create a space (Space 1) and unwatch it
 ** This step is required for isolating this problem from CONFSERVER-57698
 # Create a calendar and associate it with Space 1
 ** Confirm if User A is watching the newly create calendar
 # Create an event "Birthday" on the calendar
 ** Please don't set a user *other than User A or User B* to _Who_ field to prevent any unwanted notification
 ** User A shouldn't receive any notification as it was own update
 # Logout Confluence
 # Login Confluence with User B
 # Create an event "Birthday" on the calendar
 # Confirm if User A receives a notification about the event
 # Create an event "Leave" on the calendar
 # Confirm if User A doesn't receive any notification about the event

h3. Expected Results

User A should receive a notification in *Step 10* as well as it received in the *Step 8*.
h3. Actual Results

User A didn't receive a notification in *Step 10*.
h3. Notes
 * An even "Birthday" was created by User A *for the first time* but the other one "Leave" wasn't.
 * The event types themselves don't seem important to reproduce this bug
 -- You can reproduce this bug with any two event types

h3. Workaround

There seems to be no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Calendar creator cannot receive notification about events which were created by another user for the first time

h3. Actual Results
"Columns to display" shows two options but once user select one side, can't select the other side.

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-21 at 9.23.15.png|thumbnail!

Use different names for the custom fields on the same screen.

fields.description:
[Getting started with Confluence Data Center on Azure|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/getting-started-with-confluence-data-center-on-azure-937176452.html/#GettingstartedwithConfluenceDataCenteronAzure-ExtraSSL] suggests in the *Additional steps required for SSL* section that you need to set up SSL between the application gateway and Synchrony by linking to [Overview of end to end SSL with Application Gateway|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/application-gateway/application-gateway-backend-ssl], which specifically addresses configuring backend SSL.

However, this is inaccurate, and configuring SSL on between the load balancer and Synchrony can actually break the connection, since Synchrony does not support SSL natively (see [Possible Confluence and Synchrony Configurations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/possible-confluence-and-synchrony-configurations-958779064.html]). This link should be removed, or updated to a different Azure doc that is not about configuring SSL behind the load balancer.
fields.summary: Inaccurate link for Confluence Data Center Azure setup

 * Cross instance macro usage

 ** Page properties reporting (_Page properties report_ macro)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The cache statistics page of Confluence doesn't have HTTP Cache-Control headers. This can cause old values to display, if the size of Cache is adjusted through the User interface (Cache Management) and there is an intervening caching proxy.

h3. Environment

* Confluence v6.13
* Any middle-ware proxies like Nginx with caching capabilities

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update the cache size of any any entity.
# Refresh the page.
# Capture a HAR file.

h3. Expected Results

Note the response headers for the following request,
{code}
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:8090/rest/cacheManagement/1.0/stats",
{code}

The response should have the following HTTP header with some values to decide how caching proxies should handle this.
{code}
    "name": "Cache-Control"
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The response doesn't contain the Cache control values for the body.

h3. Workaround

Flush cache in proxies.
fields.summary: Confluence Cache statistics page shows old value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting a Word document with hyperlinks to PDF, and then attaching the PDF to a Confluence page, users cannot click the links when previewing the PDF in Confluence. 

h3. Environment
* Microsoft Word for Mac 16.21
* Confluence 6.10.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word document
# Add a hyperlink: https://google.com
# Save the file
# “Save As” and select PDF
# Create a Confluence page
# Drag/Drop the PDF file into the page
# Save the page
# Click on the PDF file to preview
# In preview window, try clicking on https://google.com

h3. Expected Results
https://google.com should load in a new browser. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. The text is not a hyperlink. 

h3. Workaround
At this time, the only workaround is to upload the file as a Word file.
fields.summary: Links do not work when previewing a PDF file exported from Word

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migrating from Server to Cloud, the time is showing differently in "Page History" tab due to the JVM timezone. This is similar issue as in Jira: JRACLOUD-65305.

h3. Environment
* Server to Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence Server, make sure the user timezone is not set / has been set to other than UTC
# Perform a space export
# Import the backup into Confluence Cloud
# Compare the "Published" time in Page History between Server and Cloud

h3. Expected Results
The time is showing the same as Confluence Server

h3. Actual Results
The time is showing 8 hours late (taking UTC+8 as the example)
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
If -Duser.timezone is not set, it will take the system timezone.

h3.Workaround
Set the user.timezone to UTC
# Under {{<installation-directory>/bin/}}
# Edit *setenv.sh*
# Add the timezone property:
{code}CATALINA_OPTS="-Duser.timezone=UTC ${CATALINA_OPTS}"{code}
fields.summary: Time is displaying differently after migrating from Server to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Description

In Confluence Cloud it's possible to drag and drop pages from the Page Tree located in the sidebar to reorder them as can be seen in this KB article [Move, copy, and hide pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html]

h3. Suggestion

Implementing the same feature in Confluence server.

h3. Current Scenario

Currently, the only available option to reorder the pages is by using the option Reorder pages from Space Tools as can be seen in the KB article to [lMove and Reorder Pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/move-and-reorder-pages-146407727.html]
fields.summary: Drag and Drop

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, the Jira Issues Macro will return up to the predefined 'Maximum Issues' limit, but displays them all in one page.  If you have, for example, 300 issues being returned, you either need to view all 300, or you set the 'Maximum Issues' limit to something less (such as 50), and then Confluence will make you click a link to see the rest of the issues in Jira.  It would be nice to have an option to display the issues in Confluence via pagination.
h2. Workaround

The old 'Dynamic Render Mode' does paginate issues, but this may break other functionality.  To enable it, you must edit the source of the Confluence page via API or  [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor] and add in
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="renderMode">dynamic</ac:parameter>
{code}
to the macro.  This changes the display and how the issues are loaded, but it does paginate the results.
fields.summary: Add Pagination to Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer isn't able to start synchrony.
 When running {{start-synchrony.sh}}, no log is generated, and process is not shown in {{ps -ef}} command in Linux.
 If running in foreground mode, {{start-synchrony.sh -fg}}, we receive the following error message:
{code:java}
Error: Could not find or load main class <node IP address>
{code}
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Data Center
 * More than 1 Synchrony Node

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Edit {{start-synchrony.sh}}
 * For the {{cluster.join.tcpip.members}}, have a space character after the comma
 Example:
{code:java}
TCPIP_MEMBERS="10.10.10.1, 10.10.10.2"
 CLUSTER_JOIN_PROPERTIES="\
 -Dcluster.join.type=tcpip \
 -Dcluster.join.tcpip.members=${TCPIP_MEMBERS}"
{code}
A) Try to start synchrony using {{./start-synchrony.sh}}
 B) Try to start synchrony in foreground using {{./start-synchrony.sh -fg}}

h3. Expected Results

For both *A)* and *B)*
 * Synchrony service to start accordingly

h3. Actual Results

A) Synchrony does not start
 Cannot be found in {{ps -ef}} output
 * No information in the log file {{atlassian-synchrony.log}}

A) Synchrony does not start
 Cannot be found in {{ps -ef}} output
 * No information in the log file {{atlassian-synchrony.log}}
 * Error message is displayed (example IP address):
{code:java}
Error: Could not find or load main class 10.10.10.2
{code}

h3. Workaround
 * Remove the space character from {{cluster.join.tcpip.members}} parameter
 Example:
{code:java}
TCPIP_MEMBERS="10.10.10.1,10.10.10.2"
 CLUSTER_JOIN_PROPERTIES="\
 -Dcluster.join.type=tcpip \
 -Dcluster.join.tcpip.members=${TCPIP_MEMBERS}"
{code}
fields.summary: Starting Synchrony Error: Could not find or load main class <node IP address>

fields.description:
Some of our teams use checkboxes on Confluence pages along with @mentions to determine whether or not each individual is present at the meeting. In this case, it doesn't make a whole lot of sense to have these lines show up under the "Tasks" page for each user - it really just clutters up the tasks, making them more difficult to efficiently use.

It would be nice to be able to have an @mention and a checkbox in the same line of text on a Confluence page without it creating a task. Perhaps a standard "checkbox" component rather than just a task component. Alternatively, if there was a way to select a task declaration, then click an onHover link (or something similar) to remove it from the task list, that would work.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create checkboxes / @mentions without creating tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Windows, if a document's name do not contain spaces and has a "&" character and the user tries to use the Companion App to edit the document, the Companion App will return an error and will fail to launch. This has been tested on Word documents and documents with the .txt extension but we believe that the behavior is the same across all other document types.


h3. Environment
* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a word document. Name it a&b.docx
# Upload it to Confluence
# Attempt to Edit the document.

h3. Expected Results
Companion App launches and the document can be edited using the related application.

h3. Actual Results
A "Windows cannot find" the document error is is returned. (see attachment)
In some cases, the companion app just hangs and does not return any error message.

h3. Tested Scenarios:
* a&b will fail
* a&bababa will fail
* a & b will work
* Financial Sample & (test) etc will work
* FinancialSample&(test)etc.xls will fail

h3. Workaround
Change the document's name by removing the "&" character.
fields.summary: Editing a document that has special characters in the document's name fails when using the Companion App.

h4. Actual Results

Upon clicking the link when the browser is resized to a smaller dimension, it doesn't take us to the right section as the header of the page seems to be blocking the Anchor location.

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-15 at 5.17.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h4. Expected Results

Links point to the right section on the page

h3. Scenario 2

* Create a page with Anchors and links pointing to the Anchor.
* Place the Anchor at the top and link in the middle of the page
* Validate if the links are pointing to the right section of the page where Anchors are specified.

h4. Actual Results

Upon clicking the link, it doesn't take us to the right section as the header of the page seems to be blocking the Anchor location.

h4. Expected Results

Links point to the right section on the page


h2. Workaround

N/A

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The information from [Configuring a Server for Outgoing Mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-server-for-outgoing-mail-151078.html] is quite unclear, and it needs to be clarified.

{quote}You can personalize email notifications by configuring the 'From' field to include the name and email address of the Confluence user who made the change.{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
There are missing words here. We need to understand there's a difference between the 'From name' and 'From address' fields.

Users see this sentence, and they are lead to believe that it means you can customize the 'From' field to equal that of the user who made the change, and after this change, can therefore simply reply to the email and the message will go to the user who initiated the change. This is not the case here, as the information below this is conflicting:

{quote}From Address: Enter the email address that will be displayed in the 'from' field for email messages originating from this server.
This field is mandatory. This must be an ordinary email address, you can't enter variables in this field.{quote}

In order to set the 'From' Name and Address fields to the initiator of the change, you would need to use variables, as this changes constantly.

It needs to be more clear that this is a cosmetic change, and the 'From Address' can not be changed in this way due to the fact that it does not accept variables. In the 'From Address' field you can only enter an email address.

h3. Why this is important
Documentation should be clear and easy to follow, and even I had a hard time understanding what it was trying to convey.
fields.summary: Configure a Server for Outgoing Email documentation has conflicting information

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian 

We are testing the new Search Experience in 6.13 and 6.14 and noted it is not compatible with Enterprise Theme and other themes available in the Atlassian Marketplace. The new search bar simply does not appear when clicking into the search bar or entering something.

We would like to make our Enterprise Theme compatible and have the new search experience as seamlessly as possible integrated into our Enterprise Theme to give our Confluence users the best experience. Other vendors supplying Themes probably face the same need. 

Please supply resources containing informations for app developers how to integrate the new search in theme apps.

Are there for example Java Script Events needed to call the search?

We are without any documentation at the moment and are unable to integrate our theme with the new search. As Confluence 6.14 is on the horizon, we want to provide full compatibility as soon as possible.       

Please provide documentation for app developers. Your help is appreciated.

Niklas
bitvoodoo
fields.summary: Confluence 6.13 and 6.14 EAP - New Search in Theme apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Exporting Space as PDF incorrectly states "Exporting Space as PDF - In Progress" regardless of the task status, this causes confusion and can be interpreted as a task not being complete
 !export as PDF.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* "- In Progress" portion of the page header should be removed altogether as it does not represent job status
* Adjust page header to change upon job completion from "- In Progress" to "- Complete"

h3. Workaround
This is a cosmetic problem and does not actually affect the export, regardless of page header export task status can be determined by "Completion" field percentage
fields.summary: "Exporting Space as PDF - In Progress" statement does not reflect the job progress

h3. Summary

# Insert a few more images below the image, and do the same to them.
#* !Edit.PNG|thumbnail!

#*  !PDF.png|thumbnail! 
#* File:  [^AS-Tester-110119-1853-68.pdf]

h3. Current behavior

fields.description:
Under some circumstances, Team Calendars will need to locate a timezone (such as during an import of an .ics file). If the file does not contain a valid timezone, TC will attempt to obtain the system's timezone in this order:

# _atlassian.confluence.settings/defaultTimeZoneId_ in Confluence's bandana table.
# _user.timezone_ Java sysprop, if set.
# Platform-specific default timezone id. JRE identifies this differently in MacOs, Linux and Windows.
# The default value: GMT

However, some of the valid values for Java's {{user.timezone}} such as "UTC" or "GMT" are not considered valid for Team Calendars, since TC's supported timezone values are based on an intersection of Joda and Ical4j timezones: [^ teamcal_supported_tz.txt]

Because TC does not consider values like "UTC" to be valid, this can cause problems during certain scenarios, like the import calendar problem described in CONFSERVER-57756
fields.summary: Improve timezone recognition for Team Calendars

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence and Team Calendars
# Set Confluence's timezone to a value that is not considered valid by Team Calendars, using a JVM parameter. For example, "UTC":
{code}
-Duser.timezone=UTC
{code}
# Try to import this .ics file into Team Calendars: [^example.ics]

h2. Expected Results
The calendar either imports or displays a reason in the UI why it cannot be imported.

h2. Actual Results
The UI shows no action when the Import button is pressed, and the dialog remains up.
Application logs show that a particular VM file cannot be found:
{code}
2018-11-21 20:07:57,826 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-4367] [opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.VelocityResult] doExecute Unable to render Velocity Template, '/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/templates/velocity/calendar3/calendar-import-subcalendar-timeZoneRequired.vm'
...
{code}

h2. Notes
From the error, we can see that the VM file does not actually exist where plugin is expecting it. In the Team Calendars JAR file, it is located in a slightly different path:
||Context||Path||
|In the exception message|/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/*templates/velocity/calendar3*/calendar-import-subcalendar-timeZoneRequired.vm|
|Within the Jar file|/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/*calendar3/templates/velocity*/calendar-import-subcalendar-timeZoneRequired.vm|

A related ticket to improve Team Calendars timezone detection has been raised here: CONFSERVER-57757

h3. Workaround
Ensure that the .ics file contains a valid timezone. Definitions and examples below:
* https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.6.5
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35645402/how-to-specify-timezone-in-ics-file-which-will-work-efficiently-with-google-outl
fields.summary: Team Calendars cannot import .ics files if no valid timezone can be found

fields.description:
As a Confluence user, I would like to be able to *search for a Russian word* and receive results that contain *similar words*.

Currently, this works in English, but not Russian. eg.
 * searching for the word *log* will return results with *logs / logged / logger*  etc
 * searching for the word ***инструкция* will +*not return*+ similar words, such as *инструкциИ*/*инструкциЕЙ*/*инструкциЮ*/*инструкциЯ*
fields.summary: Confluence Search - Similar Words in Russian

h3. Environment:

Confluence 6.12.2
h3. Bug description

Page blueprint language changed to English after blueprint is edited
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create new user account. Change user preferred language do German
 # Login as a previously created user.
 # Create new page by using "Meeting notes" (Besprechingsnotitzen) page blueprint
 # Access Confluence Administration menu -> Global Templates and Blueprints. Edit Meeting notes blueprint. Add line with plain text to the blueprint template.
 # Login as a previously created user.
 # Create new page by using "Meeting notes" (Besprechingsnotitzen) page blueprint

h3. Expected results

When creating blueprint all the components are translated to German
 !Screenshot_20190110_142723.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual results

After editing template some of the blueprint components are translated to English (even though German language selected in user profile)
 !Screenshot_20190110_142723.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
 -

* Team Calendars

2019-01-09 18:13:21,047 WARN [http-nio-6690-exec-10] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date null
 -- referer: http://localhost:6690/c690/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /c690/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: bc98094cce9e56cd | userName: charlie
{code}

 h3.Workaround
n/a

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Confluence administrator attempts to export a space that has restrictions at the root page a vague error is encountered in the logs:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space
# Create a child page
# At the root of the Space restrict the page to a user or group not containing the Confluence administrator
# Go to *Space Admin* > *Content Tools* > *Export*
# Select *PDF*
#  Select *Normal Export* and hit *Export*

h3. Expected Results
A PDF will export without content as the root page is restricted

 -- url: /c623/spaces/flyingpdf/doflyingpdf.action | referer: http://localhost:6623/c623/spaces/flyingpdf/flyingpdf.action?key=RS | traceId: 53baff733b97e8fb | userName: admin | action: doflyingpdf
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Exception while rendering the PDF document /confluence-home/atlassian-confluence-6.2.3/temp/pdfexport-20190109-090119-1416-5/RS-090119-1416-6.pdf
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.createPdfForSpace(FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:92)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:34)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask.doRunInternal(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:74)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.util.concurrent.ConfluenceExecutors$ThreadLocalContextTaskWrapper.lambda$wrap$1(ConfluenceExecutors.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.lambda$doInRequestContext$0(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:50)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.lambda$withRequestContext$2(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:66)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)

Caused by: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
	at java.util.ArrayList.rangeCheck(ArrayList.java:657)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:433)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading Confluence to 6.14 or later, admins see the following message that English_United States.1252 is not UTF-8

!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!

This is a false warning and can be ignored, *provided the client encoding* is set correctly.

h3. Background

I've had several users on Community reach out to me regarding this confusion, for example:
 * [Confluence on PostgreSQL what collation is recommended|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Confluence-on-PostgreSQL-what-collation-is-recommended/qaq-p/738405]

Until September 2019, the [Database Setup for Postgresql|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-postgresql-173244522.html] doc specified that:
{quote}Collation must also be set to utf8. Other collations, such as "C", are known to cause issues with Confluence.
{quote}
This is clear to Linux users, but for Windows users, their options might look like the following:
 * C
 * POSIX
 * English_United States.1252

During setup of the database in Windows, users are to select a locale, and are presented with the following selections:

!image.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected behavior
Confluence health check does not give the false warning when using .1252 collations

h3. Suggested Solution
We should update the health check to accept the Windows equivalent of UTF-8.

h3. Notes
[According to Postgres|https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.3/static/multibyte.html]:
{quote}UTF-8 encoding can be used with any locale.
{quote}
In addition, I reviewed this blog post, [Locale in Windows|http://www.g-loaded.eu/2011/02/27/locale-windows/], and it appears that you should be able to use English_United States.1252.

Although I believe this is addressed with the following line:
{quote}Choose the locale that best matches your geographic location.
{quote}
fields.summary: Update health check with correct encoding requirements for Windows users on installation with PostgreSQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a search using the Livesearch Macro in a space sidebar, the search bar is hidden behind the search results. This only happens if the search bar is positioned to the top half of the screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Customise a space sidebar to include the Livesearch Macro.
 {code}{livesearch}{code}
# Create 10 pages in the space, or enough pages for the space sidebar to have a scrollbar.
# Scroll so that the searchbar is at the top 25% portion of the screen.
# Insert a search term.

h3. Expected Results
The search results shouldn't hide the search bar.

 !Expected results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The search results is covering the search bar, so you can no longer see the search term.

 !Actual results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Scroll the space sidebar all the way to the top and perform the search.
fields.summary: Search bar is hidden behind search results when using the Livesearch Macro in a space sidebar

fields.description:
At times, pages in a space will be moved into the Root of the space (not under any parent page in a space). Examples:
* After restoring a previously deleted page, pages will be restored to the root of the space - [Reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/delete-or-restore-a-page-139429.html]
* Pages are reordered manually by going to Space Tools > Reorder Pages > Move pages to the same position as the Space Home Page

When this happens, these pages will not be shown in the Page Tree sidebar. 

This is misleading to users as the pages appears to be "missing".

Suggestion behavior:
* Display all pages in the Page Tree sidebar, regardless if they are at the Root of the space or not.
fields.summary: Root pages should not disappear in the Page Tree in the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently page restrictions can be set manually and this controls who has access to view and edit the page.

Users would like more control over this, such as determining when it's possible to modify a page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to only allow edits during certain times, date ranges, IP address (current location), etc.

The IP address idea would ensure that you can only edit a page if you're within a specific network, for example.

h3. Why this is important
 Greater control of Confluence
fields.summary: Page Restrictions based on additional factors (time, date, IP, etc.)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Log4j logging option toggle doesn't change the log level under non-English language setting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Change user language to Japanese
# Navigate to _Confluence管理 > ログとプロファイルの作成 > Log4j ログ作成_ (It was shown as _Confluence administration > Logging and Profiling > Log4j Logging_ under English language setting.)
# Press *診断用* button (*Diagnostic* in English)

h3. Expected Results

The log4j log level should be changed to *Diagnostic*.

h3. Actual Results

The log4j log level didn't change.

h3. Notes

When pressing the button, the following data was contained in the body of the HTTP request to http(s):/<confluence-base-url>//admin/changeloggingprofile.action.

* atl_token: 4fdf1903dda426520a46efac576a6a8b7edde64e
* profileName: 診断用

{{profileName}} wasn't translated into English before it was sent to server.

h3. Workaround

Change the language setting to English.
fields.summary: Log4j logging option toggle never change log level under non-English language setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Directly accessing the jpg attachment will bring up 403 error screen  !Screen Shot 2019-01-08 at 2.12.27 PM.png|width=119,height=35,thumbnail!  while other attachments like pdf, text doc, .png etc will bring up login screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add a jpg and a .png or .pdf attachment
 # Click on the attachment and copy the link from the browser
 # Now, either log out or open Incognito window and try to access the link.

h3. Expected Results

It should route the user to login screen.
h3. Actual Results

If the attachment is with *jpg* extension, it will bring up a 403 error page. However, for any other attachment, it does bring up the login screen.
h3. Workaround
 # Go to the page > click on three dots on top right corner (***) > attachments
 # It will list the attachments. Now click on the Properties tab on the right corner of any JPG image
 # Copy the link that is presented in the browser window and try accessing the same URL after you log out of the Server or in Incognito window.
Example
 [http://localhost:8090/pages/editattachment.action?pageId=16613377&fileName=IMG_1503.jpg] *<- This link you will get when you click on the properties tab and it will take you to the login screen.*
 [http://localhost:8090/download/attachments/16613377/IMG_1503.jpg?api=v2] *<- However, this link is when you click on the image in the browser directly and this will result in 403 error*
 [http://localhost:8090/download/attachments/16613377/20181110-statements-9638-.pdf?api=v2] <- This is the pdf link that is generated the same way by clicking on the attachment and it will route the login screen unlike above.
fields.summary: Direct link to jpg attachment bring up error screen instead of login screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Confluence user is watching only for new blog posts from a Space, the *Stop Watching* button in User Preferences (*Watches* page) does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a user, [watch for new blog posts in a space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs-139579.html#WatchPages,SpacesandBlogs-Watchfornewblogpostsinaspace].
 ## Go to a blog post in the space.
 ## Choose *Watch* and select *Watch for new blog posts in this space*.
# Choose *your profile picture* at top right of the screen, then choose *Watches*.
# Under *Space Watches*, choose *Stop Watching* for any entry showing _Only watching news_.
# *Stop Watching* link changes to *Start Watching*, showing to the user that the request was processed.
# Refresh the page and the same space is still in the *Space Watches* list.

h3. Expected Results
After clicking in the *Stop Watching* of spaces with _Only watching news_ option, the user should not be watching for new blog posts from that space.

h3. Actual Results
User is still watching the space.

h3. Workaround
# Choose *your profile picture* at top right of the screen, then choose *Watches*.
# Under *Space Watches*, click on the name of the space you don't want to watch for new blog posts.
# On the _side bar_, click on *Blog*.
# Click on *Stop watching this Blog*.

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to store a configurable friendly name and a list of friendly tags for each article.

This information should only be accessible and configurable by space admins and above.

The goal is to be able to use this 'meta' information about the articles in the design and structure of information across our wikis.

The friendly name and friendly tags would be added to an article's Friendly Details screen, accessed through the standard page menu, and only available to those with space admin privileges or higher.

*Friendly name*

In particularly large spaces, there is often the requirement to name article with over-long names to in order to ensure uniqueness across the space and also to heavily contextualise the info, such as a single space containing the details for multiple tools used on a single project. Each article pertaining to a single tool requires the tool's name prepended to ensure uniqueness. However, in the body of the relevant tool's articles, this extra naming is actual inconvenient, unnecessary, and occassionally intrusive.

A 'friendly name' would allow information designers to dispense with the extra naming baggage, and create articles that read better.

I'm aware of the ability to set custom text while including links in articles, but that text once changed breaks the logical link with the article and can forever be missed when updates are made to the article directly.

The friendly name allows for a single point of update, while options to use the article's title or the article's friendly name in links, children displays, content by label, and other macros give us many more options.

*Friendly tags*

Labels and tags are a great way to categorise and gather articles together, not least of all with the plethora of macros available but also in searches.

However, labels as currently implemented have two drawbacks:
 # They are permanently visible on the page, which may not be appropriate for certain categories (secret projects, keywords, etc.).
 # There is no specific permission to gate access to labels. Access to the page is all that is needed to add labels or even remove labels, some of which are invaluable to the organisation of information.

Friendly tags, added and maintained in the same screen as the friendly name, would be hidden to all other than space admins and above. They would remain unmolested from accidental deletion or unintentional hijacking by others who innocently reuse a 'restricted' or administrative label on their own content.

 

Both these friendly features give content managers the confidence to arrange their content free from fear of their efforts being interfered with, however innocently, by other wiki users.
fields.summary: Article meta information - Friendly name and hidden tags

fields.description:
Hi!

Some questions regarding the Java Support mail:
 * It looks like you are planning to do a hard switch from Java 8 to 11 with the next major update of Confluence. Why don't you support both versions for some time as you do it in Jira? In Europe there are some kind of Managed Server products which are your own dedicated servers but centrally managed by the web hosting companies. Some of these environments are still 32 bit and web hosting companies are not really able to change this, because a lot of their clients don't want to update their old scripts. In these environments it won't be possible to install Java 11.
 * Why do you send important mails like this at a time, where all of your European clients have already startet their Christmas holidays?

Best regards,

Tobias
fields.summary: Java 11 / OpenJDK support update for Server and Data Center products

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When macro parameters contains any or combination of characters: ["=", "|", "<"], values are escaped incorrectly when CustomHtmlEditorPlaceholder is used.
h3. Environment

Confluence *5.10 to 6.12*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Define a macro implementing CustomHtmlEditorPlaceholder
 # Add some parameters to it
 # Try to save the macro with parameters containing '=' or '|'

-> the value of data-macro-parameters attribute on the placeholder is wrongly escaped
 -> trying to get the macro parameters to custom macro editor fails because there are unescaped '=' and '|' characters inside individual macro parameter values
 -> these values are interpreted as separators for macro parameters and the macro parameters are parsed wrongly

-> some parameters end up missing altogether (so probably some error happens somewhere)
h3. Expected Results

Macro parameters are escaped correctly
h3. Actual Results

Macro parameters are escaped incorrectly and lost when trying to further edit the macro
h3. Notes
 * '<' fails but for a different reason
 (CustomPlaceholderEditorMarshaller.generateCommonMacroAttributes does a substringBetween call that does not work as expected if the macro parameter value contains '>' characters)
 * Root Cause - The bug is in {{CustomPlaceholderEditorMarshaller.decorateCustomHtml}}:

 # It first uses {{generateCommonAttributes()}} to get a string that contains correctly escaped data-macro-parameters attribute
 # Then it uses the escaped string as 'replacement' argument when calling {{matcher.replaceAll()}}
 # the code does not take into account that also the 'replacement' argument would need to escape the '\' characters by doubling them
 [https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/regex/Matcher.html#replaceAll(java.lang.String])

h3. Workaround

This can be fixed by pre-escaping the parameter values inside the getCustomPlaceholder() call and mutating the macro parameters map received as an argument
h3. Impact

Possibly affects *_1,219_* app installs
fields.summary: Macro parameters containing '=' or '|' are escaped incorrectly when CustomHtmlEditorPlaceholder is used

fields.description:
h3. Description
The user tried to sign up via {{User Signup Option}} with a not allowed domain. However, when the user submits the information, Confluence does not show the error that the user is not able to signup and only refreshed the page.

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Administration > User Management > User Signup Options
2. Select the option 'Allow people to sign up to create their account'
3. Mark the option 'Restricted by Domain(s)' and add domains of your choice
4. Save the configuration
5. Log out of the instance
6. Click on the 'Sign up here' link on the login page
7. Fill in the form and use an email address that is not from the domains you chose
8. Click on the 'Sign up' button

*Expectation*
Display a message stating that the user cannot sign up with the email address desired and the sign up has failed.
 
*Actual Behavior*
Nothing happens, the page just refreshes.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: not error message when user with restricted doamin sign up for an account
Database configuration is far too complicated to deliver with confidence

fields.description:
We have Atlassian Confluence 6.12.1 server installed and sometimes we see the search shows an error 

*Oops, something went wrong with your search.*
 We could not successfully complete the search. No field exists with the name: 'test' Did you mean one of : text, type, title

Then we found out, it due to *Advanced CQL search*

h3. Steps to reproduce

1. In Confluence, switch to *Advanced CQL search* and search for something, like: *space=HR* or *text~test*. This works fine.
 2. Then, in the *Quick Search* (top right menu navigator), search for something like: *test*, then search page flash for a second with basic search results, but quickly show an error 
{noformat}
Oops, something went wrong with your search.
We could not successfully complete the search. No field exists with the name: 'test' Did you mean one of : text, type, title{noformat}
We believe the error was due to in the search box has *test* as a text, but since we were using CQL search previously, it defaults to the advance search and *test* is of course an invalid CQL search term hence the error shown.

h3. Suggestion:

a. To always default to basic search when using Quick Search
 b. OR to add a toggle in settings page to allow item a. above
 c. OR to always add *text*~SEARCH_TEXT or a smart function in back-end to determine what users are searching for (like in JIRA Quick Search)
fields.summary: Default Confluence search to Basic to avoid error message Oops something went wrong with your search

fields.description:
*Steps To Replicate*
 # In *JIRA* side, go to a project workflow and edit it
 # Select the 'Create' transition
 # Select the *Validators* option
 # Click 'Add validator'
 # Select the 'Fields Required' option
 # Select a system field (which is *Locked* by default) (e.g. *Epic Link*)
 # Publish workflow
 # In *Confluence*, try to create a new Jira Issue by following the steps below:
 # Highlight some text on your page and choose the !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/427623543/704578381/1/1422394769659/Creat+JIRA+Issue.png|width=19! *Create Jira issue* icon that appears above the highlighted text.
 ## Enter your *server* (if you have multiple Jira sites connected to Confluence), *project* that contain the required field, *issue type* and *description*.
 ## Choose *Create*.
 
*Expected Behaviour*
The required field listed in the form to create the Jira Issue.

*Actual Behaviour*
(i) The required field cannot be filled out because it is not listed in the form to create the Jira Issue and the following ERROR appear in the UI:
{code}
There were errors creating issues in Jira
The <required_field> is required.
{code}

*Workaround*
Create the issue directly in JIRA
fields.summary: Create Jira Issue from Confluence failed if the Jira Project contains fields made required through workflow Validators in Jira

The link has the JWT as value of an query parameter named "jwt". Please change that to "access_token", as this is a common way to pass a JWT in a request (RFC 6749).
