fields.description:
As a documentation maintainer, I want to know what searches are failing to find good results in the confluence Search tool.

I would like to see some information on:
 # Pages that have not been accessed for a very long time.
 # Searches that turned up no results.
 # Searches that resulted in a high bounce rate. Eg: User clicks on a lot of pages for a search, but can't seem to find a good result.
 # Search results that result in a high bounce rate. Eg: Users often click on this page, but it's not what they were searching for (regardless of whether they were different searches).

This will help me find pages that have been abandoned (1), or search results that are under documented (2, 3), or that show up in misleading search results (4).
fields.summary: Add SEO-oriented tools for managing poorly accessed documentation

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# When the HTML macro is used, users are allowed to use<body> tags.
# The use of this tag will override the default <body> tag of the page, causing Confluence not to load the rest of the content on the page after the HTML macro.
# It would good if we have some sort of note to inform the user about this to prevent confusion.
#* CONFSERVER-18486

h4. Current behavior 
# No indication to the user that the use of <body> tag in a <body> tag will cause Confluence to stop rendering the rest of the page.

h4. Suggested behavior
# Add a note to inform the user about the behavior with the <body> tag.
fields.summary: Add a note in the HTML macro, letting users know that the use of <body> tags will replace the page's default <body> tag

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When saving changes to a file in Office 365 you'll receive an error:
{code}
UPLOAD FAILED Your file wasn't uploaded because your chagnes can't be merged with changes made by someone else.
{code}

h3. Environment
Office 365

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a machine with Office 365 open a document from Confluence via "Edit in Office"
# Make changes to the file
# Save the file

h3. Expected Results
The file is saved and uploaded to Confluence. A new version of the file is available

h3. Actual Results
You'll run into the error in Office:
{code}
UPLOAD FAILED Your file wasn't uploaded because your chagnes can't be merged with changes made by someone else.
{code}

There are no errors in the Confluence logs

h3. Workaround
To workaround this bug you have two options:
# Select *Save a Copy*
## Save a copy to the location designated
## The file will be properly uploaded to Confluence with a new version
# Select *Discard Changes*
## Any changes you've just made will be removed
## Make the desired changes again
## Save the file
## This time the file will be properly uploaded with a new version
## Note, the Office document will not close automatically after the upload in this scenario
fields.summary: Edit in Office with Office 365 generates "Upload Failed Error"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to use the companion app in Confluence to edit a PDF file in Adobe Reader DC does not update Confluence on the first save.

Could reproduce in Windows 10, but not in Mac OS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
_Sample pdf for the steps below: [^test_pdf.pdf]_
# Preview a PDF on the page and open in Adobe Reader DC using the Companion App (*Edit with* > *Edit with Acrobat Reader*)
# Make a change to the pdf (e.g. highlight some text)
# Go to *File* > *Save*.
# In the "Save as" prompt, overwrite the file in the correlating companion app folder.
!reader_saveas.png|thumbnail! !replaceit_prompt.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
With the new file saved, Confluence will detect the change and activate the "Upload" button to upload the new version of the file.
!active_button.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The change is not detected, the button is inactive, and the updated file cannot be uploaded.
!inactive_button.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* Could reproduce in Windows 10, but not in Mac OS.
* Reader opens the "Save as" prompt on all first saves, even for existing files.

h3. Workaround
Two known workarounds:
* Make another edit in Adobe Reader and save. All saves after the initial "Save as" prompt should activate the "Upload" button in Confluence.
* Download the file and upload the new attachment version to the page (not using the companion app, [Upload Files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/upload-files-139513.html])
fields.summary: Saving a PDF file in Adobe Reader DC via the companion app in Windows does not update the file in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary * When you edit a page with sections in it and click on the left side of the editor, a white space is added at the beginning of the section. If you look at the storage format, you can see that the following tag was added in the page: {code} p>

{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page with sections. !1.png|thumbnail! # Publish the page. # Edit the page. # On the editor, click on the left side of it. !2.png|thumbnail! h3. Expected Results * No changes are seen in the editor. h3. Actual Results * A white space is added in the section and is not editable. The following tag is added in the page: {code} p>

{code} h3. Workaround # Publish the page with the extra white space in it. # Edit the page again. # The white space is now editable and you can remove it.
fields.summary: Clicking on the left side of Confluence's editor adds an extra white space in the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing the language in Jira, the custom fields that have added translation will disappear from Jira Issue Macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a custom field in Jira and add a translation in the desired language.
 Add Jira Issue Macro in Confluence Page and navigate to macro display options to include this custom field
 Change the language in Jira
h3. Expected Results

The custom field should show the translated name along with the assigned value
h3. Actual Results

The custom field remains the same, but the value is missing.

!Screen Shot 2018-12-28 at 2.22.00 PM.png|width=534,height=245! 
 When you edit the macro, you will notice that the field is not on the list anymore.
h3. Workaround

Create a new custom field without translation
h3. Workaround 2

Manually add the translated custom field from the list in Macro settings
fields.summary: Custom fields not displayed in Jira issue macro when changing the language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
No submit button on support.atlassian.com when selecting Questions for Confluence under product Marketplace Apps, see the attached screenshot.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Marketplace Apps
* Questions for Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to support.atlassian.com
# Select *Technical Issues and Bugs* under *What can we help you with?*
# Then select *Marketplace Apps* under *Which product is this for?*
# And select *Questions for Confluence* under *Which Marketplace app?*

h3. Expected Results
There should be a submit button or something which should tell the next step.


h3. Actual Results
No submit button appears
 
h3. Notes
The customer can create ticket related to Questions for Confluence by selecting Confluence as a product in spite of Marketplace Apps but the point is why this option is even given if it takes to nothing.

h3. Workaround
The customer can create ticket related to Questions for Confluence by selecting Confluence as a product in spite of Marketplace Apps
fields.summary: No submit button on support.atlassian.com when selecting Questions for Confluence under product Marketplace Apps
